hero.title: Meantime Studio
hero.subtitle: A design practice dedicated to quiet, enduring interiors shaped by light, material and proportion.

narrative.title: A measured way of making space
paragraphs: Meantime Studio works across homes, mixed-use and small hospitality projects. Each commission is treated as a long conversation rather than a single gesture — from first sketches to the moment light hits the finished room.
The studio favours calm plans, generous circulation and a restrained material palette. Instead of decoration layered on top, structure, joinery and light do most of the work.

meta.title: Practice
meta.text: Independent interior design studio based in Outram, Singapore, working with a network of local makers and builders.

meta.title: Clients
meta.text: Homeowners, boutique developers and hospitality operators who value long-term, quiet spaces over short-lived trends.

meta.title: Scope
meta.text: Concept design, spatial planning, material specification, bespoke joinery and on-site design stewardship.

approach.title: How we work
approach.description: A simple, structured process that keeps every project specific to its context — and to the people who will live with it.

steps.title: Listening & mapping
steps.text: We begin by understanding routines, adjacencies and existing light, translating conversations into clear spatial diagrams.

steps.title: Plans, mock-ups, models
steps.text: Scaled drawings and physical tests refine proportion, storage and circulation before finishes are selected.

steps.title: Material & detail
steps.text: We develop a tight material palette and joinery language, paying close attention to thresholds, edges and touchpoints.

steps.title: On-site stewardship
steps.text: The studio stays present on site — checking samples, refining details and aligning all trades around the design intent.
